intro: Danthoniopsis pobeguinii, commonly known as the Pobeguin's grass, is a rare and unique species belonging to the Poaceae family. It is native to the island of La Réunion in the Indian Ocean and is characterized by its low-growing, tufted habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the island's tropical climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
